Class ZenMode

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.mode.ZenMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameMode
public class ZenMode extends Object implements GameMode
Implements the "Zen" ruleset for a relaxed, infinite gameplay experience.

This strategy alters the core game mechanics to remove stress and punishment:

  • High scores and levels are disabled.
  • Game speed remains constant (no leveling up).
  • "Danger" effects (shaking, intense music) are suppressed.
  • The player has infinite "Undos" to practice placement.
  • Game Over results in an immediate board reset rather than a termination screen.

    • isHighScoreEnabled

      public boolean isHighScoreEnabled()
      Determines if the current game session should be recorded in the high score file.
      Specified by:
      isHighScoreEnabled in interface GameMode
      Returns:
      false, as Zen mode is for practice and does not track competitive records.

    • isLevelingEnabled

      public boolean isLevelingEnabled()
      Determines if the game difficulty (speed) should increase as lines are cleared.
      Specified by:
      isLevelingEnabled in interface GameMode
      Returns:
      false, ensuring the game speed remains constant for a relaxing experience.

    • isDangerAllowed

      public boolean isDangerAllowed()
      Determines if "Danger" visual effects (shaking, intense music) should play when the stack reaches the top of the board.
      Specified by:
      isDangerAllowed in interface GameMode
      Returns:

    • isLevelLabelVisible

      public boolean isLevelLabelVisible()
      Controls the visibility of the Level counter in the UI.
      Specified by:
      isLevelLabelVisible in interface GameMode
      Returns:
      false, hiding the level counter since progression is disabled.

    • getUndoLimit

      public int getUndoLimit()
      Returns an effectively infinite undo limit.

      This allows players to experiment with brick placement and correct mistakes indefinitely without penalty.

      Specified by:
      getUndoLimit in interface GameMode
      Returns:
      Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • handleGameOver

      public void handleGameOver(GameController gameController)
      Triggers the Zen Mode "Auto-Restart" sequence.

      Instead of showing a Game Over screen, this strategy commands the controller to immediately clear the board and start a fresh game, creating a seamless loop.

      Specified by:
      handleGameOver in interface GameMode
      Parameters:
      gameController - the controller used to reset the game state.
